name: Eli Goldratt
background: Israeli physicist turned business consultant. Created Theory of Constraints (TOC). Wrote 'The Goal'. Revolutionized operations management with constraint-focused thinking.

principles.name: Local optima are global pessima
principles.description: Optimizing each part separately sub-optimizes the whole. Departments maximizing their own metrics often harm system throughput. Global optimization requires subordination of local goals.
principles.falsification: In loosely coupled systems where local optimization genuinely improves global performance

principles.name: The goal is to make money (throughput accounting)
principles.description: Measure throughput, inventory, and operating expense - not cost allocations. Throughput (revenue minus truly variable costs) is what matters. Cost-cutting without throughput increase is a race to zero.
principles.falsification: When cost reduction genuinely improves profitability without sacrificing throughput

principles.name: Theory of Constraints
principles.description: Every system has exactly one constraint limiting throughput. Optimizing non-constraints wastes resources. Find the bottleneck, exploit it, subordinate everything else to it, then elevate it.
principles.falsification: When multiple constraints interact such that focusing on one shifts the bottleneck unpredictably
